Our findings reveal #CFOs in Africa are significantly more concerned than their global peers about issues such as increased costs of doing business, supply chain disruptions and cybersecurity risks. Here’s why: http://ow.ly/zPNp50AlDM5  #CFOPulse

Since March 2020, PwC has been tracking sentiment and priorities among finance leaders about the COVID-19 outbreak. Our 2nd edition surveyed 41 #CFOs from nine countries in sub-Saharan Africa, between 1 and 14 June. Full report here:http://ow.ly/MkkP50Alsk6  #CFOPulse

COVID-19 has brought new ways of working for many. How should orgs think differently about #upskilling and #reskilling their workers for a future that is much less predictable than we once thought? Read our latest #TalentTrends2020 report here:   http://ow.ly/whfp50AchHx
African corporate issuers raised $4.3 billion of non-local currency debt in 2019, a decrease of 28% in terms of value, from 2018. Learn more: http://ow.ly/PcEq50yKOUE   #ACMW19GIF
2019 saw the lowest in further offer proceeds in Africa over the past decade with $3.5 billion raised from 59 FO deals. Learn more: http://ow.ly/Im7R50yHGBB   #ACMW19GIF
